alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:39PM MDT until June 17 at 12:45AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Elbert and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 930 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways and several roads are closed. Some low-water crossings may be impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 939 PM MDT, Emergency management reported flooded and damaged roadways in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Limon, Hugo, Arriba, Genoa, Punkin Center, Boyero, Kutch, Matheson and Cedar Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
